item.title: Working with DB datetime/date columns in Go
item.description: This post shows how to work with DATETIME/DATE columns in DB and use Go standard time.Time avoiding manual string parsing. This article contains examples using 2 packages: database/sql and github.com/go-sql-driver/mysql. Retrieve nullable time field using NullTime type MySQL, PostgreSQL drivers in Go provide this nullable type which represents a time.Time that may be NULL. NullTime implements the Scanner interface so it can be used as a scan destination: Use parseTime=true Assuming you’re using the go-sql-driver/mysql you can ask the driver to scan DATE and DATETIME automatically to time.
